wordList.title: Things which we might include in the main list
wordList.description: These have potential, but it's not clear how many routines they appear in

words.description: [Fashion police] a deliberate change of an item of clothing in the middle of a routine
[Fashion police] eg. a knee or wrist brace, or physio tape
[Fashion police] must be visible!
[Fashion police]
[Solo dance step] full splits or jazz splits
[Solo dance step]
[Solo dance step]
[Solo dance step]
[Partnered dance step] swingout where leader puts follower in an armlock and follower spins out of it.
[Air step] from closed position, flyer jumps, assisted by the base. Flyer pulls knees up as high as possible (like a frog)
[Air step] flyer does a backward somersault around the leader's hip. Too hard to distinguish from knickerbocker/ round the back/ Kay flip?
[Air step] base ducks, flyer dives over their back and ends up parallel to the floor between the base's legs. Too similar to "waterfall"?

[Dance styles]

wordList.title: Things which are too ambiguous?
wordList.description: It's not great if it's quite unclear if something has happened or not

words.description: One or more people are in the spotlight (eg. in a jam circle) and the people not dancing there imitate some of their movement - eg jumping when they jump or spinning when they spin. Problematic: this often happens as a way for the rest of the group to sync up with the spotlight dancers, which is ambiguous.

wordList.title: Things which are just too rare?
wordList.description: It's not that interesting to have something on your card whch is quite unlikely to ever show up

words.description: Thrower lifts the flyer upside down above their head
Thrower throws the flyer back over their shoulder
An exit move from A Day At The Races: two dancers balance on a third dancer, who walks offstage
[Formations]
A canon of couples doing The Pancake air step
A canon of couples swinging out on different beats
